title: Research
text:
This is a page about my research projects
Current research projects:
I am a co-founder of LASER at UMN.
We are currently doing research on developing reasoning around algorithmic modelling, conducting code review, and assessing the validity of instruments used in statistics education research. Check out our website for more information!
Past Projects

DSC-WAV Evaluation Graduate Student Assistant
Data2Graphs
STI
COMPUTES
Data Science Assessment
Dissertation Project

title: Teaching
text:
My teaching practices stem from my knowledge of statistics and my studies in educational psychology and measurement. In my classroom, students learn to think critically about statistics through collaboration with their peers in small-group, guided discovery learning activities and using thoughtfully developed assessments and curriculum informed by research. I aim to provide students with the tools they need to be thoughtful data consumers, producers, and communicators while creating a classroom atmosphere where students feel welcome to ask questions and participate in meaningful discussions.
I currently teach the master’s level introductory statistics courses:

EPSY 5261: Introductory Statistical Methods
EPSY 5262: Intermediate Statistical Methods

And I oversee an undergraduate data visualization course:

EPSY 1261: Understanding Data Stories Through Visualization and Computing

title: Chelsey Legacy
text:
I am currently an Assistant Teaching Professor at the University of Minnesota teaching gradate level introductory statistics courses in the Educational Psychology department. I also oversee an undergraduate course focused on visualization. My research interests focus on statistics and data science education, particularly in relation to coding and data visualization.


Ph.D. Educational Psychology - Quantitative Methods | University of Minnesota
M.S. Statistics | Iowa State University
B.A in Mathematics | St. Lawrence University



Assistant Teaching Professor | University of Minnesota | Quantitative Methods in Education | 2022 - Present
